intro: Tarenna brevicymigera, commonly known as the short-stemmed tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces red, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Tarenna brevicymigera thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
